item.description:
Hi Guys!

This is a great meeting place for students in Cambridge, Central Square between Harvard Square and Kendall Square/MIT stops on the red line.

This is a Palestinian Cafe House which serves a wide variety of coffee and tea. The restaurant has healthy Middle Eastern appetizers and full dinners as well but you don't have to buy food...just coffee or tea. www.andalacafe.com

for the menu click here. Please be aware that there will be an 18% automatic service tip added to your bill because we are a group larger than 8 people. You must also factor 6.25% sales tax to your bill.Suggestion: Add the price of the items you have ordered, then multiply by 25%, then  this amount to your bill to get the total bill.

PLEASE MAINTAIN YOUR OWN BILL!!!

 

Lauren and Audrey will be there to help facilitate great discussions and conversation.  If there is a small group, we will be at the same table. This is relaxed playing of board games such as Backgammon, checkers and chess with great conversation and discussions.

 

See you there!

See the MENU here..Scroll down using the side arrows inside the menu window

 

For Directions Click here

 

Take the MBTA subway RED LINE to Central Square in Cambridge. Turn Left, crossing Massachusetts Ave to Western Ave.  Western Ave & River Street intersect at Massachusetts Ave.  Walk down River Street along the right side of the big red brick church. Andala Cafe is on the corner of River Street and Franklin Street behind the Big red brick church right in the center of Central Square.

 

Are there any Certified ESL Teachers, student Teachers or Native Proficient/ Advanced Level Non native speakers who wish to volunteer to help facilitate this or upcoming meetings? Please indicate in your rsvp comments and email Lauren and I will add you as an event host.
item.how_to_find_us: Go downstairs to the large group table with the meetup sign

group.name: The Boston English as a Second Language Meetup Group

item.name: Speak English Now!
